intro: Salicornia mossiana, commonly known as sea bean or marsh glasswort, is a flowering plant native to coastal and saline environments. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, cylindrical stems that often appear glassy or translucent. The plant produces small, green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, typically blooming in late summer. Salicornia mossiana is adapted to saltwater conditions, making it a hardy species found in estuaries and tidal flats. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important component of coastal ecosystems.
